channel.title: Whonix 13.0.0.1.4 developers-only
channel.description:
https://download.whonix.org/linux/13.0.0.1.4/
* Networking fixed. * Disabled predictable network interfaces. (as per https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-14-0-0-0-7-developers-only) * These are 64 bit (amd64) images, based on Debian stretch and KDE plasma 5.
Workstation KDE start menu is totally broken for a yet to be discovered reason. One can right click on sdwdate-gui, click open log, right click the in the console window, click "show menu bar", and open a new terminal to investigate or otherwise play around.

item.title: Whonix 13.0.0.1.4 developers-only
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
https://download.whonix.org/linux/14.0.0.4.8/ is out in separate threat. Locking.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 13.0.0.1.4 developers-only
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
kde start menu bug found and fixed.

github.com/Whonix/tb-updater

fix permission issue resulting from requirement to run tb-updater as root 

from postinst since Debian stretch
refactor settings detection code to make it more understandable
This also prevents /home/user/.cache being owned by root, which...
by adrelanos on 08:09PM - 03 Feb 17
changed 2 files with 94 additions and 82 deletions.

There won’t be an apt-get dist-upgrade to fix this bug since these images are supposed to be trashed when the next image is out.

To manually fix it and to make the workstation work, run the following command.

sudo chown --recursive user:user /home/user

May also require to sudo service sddm stop, running from a virtual console rm -r .cache and sudo reboot.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 13.0.0.1.4 developers-only
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Since it is broken on the workstation only, not on the gateway, it is
most likely caused by something that Whonix does. Newer packages from
Debian would probably not solve it.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 13.0.0.1.4 developers-only
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Patrick:

KDE start menu is totally broken

Any pointers? I want to give this build a go but without knowing where to look it will be for nothing.

Is there a more recent package archive snapshot released we can rebase on?

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 13.0.0.1.4 developers-only
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
https://download.whonix.org/linux/13.0.0.1.4/

  • Networking fixed.
  • Disabled predictable network interfaces. (as per https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-14-0-0-0-7-developers-only)
  • These are 64 bit (amd64) images, based on Debian stretch and KDE plasma 5.

Workstation KDE start menu is totally broken for a yet to be discovered reason. One can right click on sdwdate-gui, click open log, right click the in the console window, click “show menu bar”, and open a new terminal to investigate or otherwise play around.

Read full topic
